meanings.definition: The money a passenger on public transportation has to pay.
meanings.sent1: I paid my fare for the bus ride.
meanings.sent2: The fare for the train journey was reasonable.
meanings.sent3: The fare for the ferry was so high, I almost swam across!
meanings.sent4: Her fare for the taxi ride was like a small fortune.
meanings.sent5: The fare for the subway was etched in my memory.

meanings.definition: To perform in a specified way in a particular situation.
meanings.sent1: She will fare well in the upcoming exam.
meanings.sent2: How did the team fare in the match?
meanings.sent3: I wonder how the magician will fare with his new trick.
meanings.sent4: The seedlings fared poorly in the dry soil.
meanings.sent5: The ship fared through the storm bravely.

meanings.sent1: I hope you fare better in your next attempt.
meanings.sent2: How did the new student fare on the first day?
meanings.sent3: The cat fared well with its new toy.
meanings.sent4: The business fared profitably in the first quarter.
meanings.sent5: She fared through the challenges with determination.
